Problem:
class VehicleSystem { constructor() { this.fuelLevel = 100; this.isEngineOn = false; this.speed = 0; } turnOnEngine() { if (this.fuelLevel > 0) { this.isEngineOn = true; this.speed = 10; } } drive() { if (this.isEngineOn) { this.fuelLevel -= 10; this.speed += 20; } } turnOffEngine() { this.isEngineOn = false; this.speed = 0; } checkFuelLevel() { return this.fuelLevel; } }",

If the 'turnOnEngine' method is called, will the 'speed' definitely be greater than 0?
Explanation: Calling 'turnOnEngine' sets 'isEngineOn' to true and initializes 'speed' to 10, assuming fuelLevel > 0, which directly increases 'speed' from 0 to 10, showing the effect of turning on the engine on the vehicle's speed without any other intervention.
